definition: trial marriage/to live together before deciding whether to marry

sentences.english: Another scene about love is the trial marriage of Xiaoxiao and Qin Fen.
sentences.chinese: 另一个爱情故事是笑笑和秦奋的试婚。

sentences.english: Shihun was mentioned in the Dunhuang document from Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 试婚在中国唐时敦煌文献中有侧面的记载。

sentences.english: Still, I believe that many Chinese still find it hard to accept this idea.
sentences.chinese: 但是我相信，很多中国人还是不接受试婚这一概念的。

definition: lit. naked wedding/no-frills civil wedding ceremony lacking a material foundation: no car, house, reception, rings, or honeymoon
to get married soon after meeting (abbr. for 閃電結婚|闪电结婚[shan3 dian4 jie2 hun1]) (neologism c. 2005)
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
forced marriage/arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
to get divorced shortly after marriage/to resign shortly after getting employed
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
